text.p: Here are highlights of stories in Skopje press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories nor does it vouch for their accuracy.
- Industrial production in Janaury-May period rose 2.9 percent against the same period in 1996, statistics office said.
- Skopje and Bitola Universities will enroll 5,712 students on Wednesday and Thursday.
- There will be no changes in Macedonian foreign policy, said the parliamentary foreign policy commission.
- The negotiations with Audi for opening an assembly car plant in Macedonia are making swift progress, says government spokesman Zoran Ivanov.
- Macedonia repeated its request for UNPREDEP forces to remain in the country, said defence minister Lazar Kitanoviski on his return from the working session of NATO members in Prague.

- Depositors in the collapsed savings society TAT from Bitola said would sue the Macedonian state before the International court in The Hague. They announced more protests, traffic blockades and other forms of expressing their dissatisfaction.
- The governemnt agreed to increase salaries to striking employees in court administration.
- Congress of the two ethnic Albanian parties PDPA and NDP to be held in July when they are expected to unify in the Democratic Party of Albanians. -- Mircela Casule, Skopje newsroom 389 91 201 196
